image.altText: People survey a large pile of rubble

props.synopsis: The IDF confirms it has bombed residential blocks in Beirut's south, claiming they contained the Hezbollah headquarters. Multiple media reports in the region say the strikes targeted Hezbollah's Secretary General Hassan Nasrallah. Follow live.

title.children: Massive explosions in Beirut as IDF says it has hit Hezbollah headquarters 'embedded' in residential buildings

image.altText: Heavy smoke rises above a residential building.

props.synopsis: Israel's military confirms it bombed several residential buildings in southern Beirut, claiming Hezbollah's "central headquarters" were embedded underneath.

title.children: Hezbollah leader Hassan Nasrallah was target of blasts, Arab and Israeli media say

image.altText: A man speaks at a podium with his finger raised to make a point

props.synopsis: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu uses an address to the United Nations General Assembly to send a warning to Iran and its allies, as calls for a ceasefire in his country's wars against Hezbollah and Hamas grow louder.

title.children: Netanyahu tells UN there is 'no place' in the Middle East that Israel's 'long arm cannot reach'

image.altText: A woman in glasses with cropped grey hair

props.synopsis: Australian Foreign Minister Penny Wong will use her address to the United Nations General Assembly to call for the international community to come together amid more conflict on Earth than any time since World War II.Â

title.children: Foreign Minister Penny Wong to warn UN General Assembly that world is 'enshrouded in darkness'

image.altText: A composite image of Jim Chalmers and Anthony Albanese

props.synopsis: Labor's inability to come clean about who ordered the Treasury to work on negative gearing left the government and prime minister Anthony Albanese smeared as tricky, dissembling and guilty of treating voters with contempt.

title.children: 'What on earth just happened this week': 48 hours of confusion has backfired on Labor

image.altText: Ruby (right) and George (right) sitting with their cat cartier in their living room .

props.synopsis: Australians in Lebanon face flight cancellations amid growing hostilities between Hezbollah and Israel. Others who can't leave family behind are choosing to stay.

title.children: Ruby fled Lebanon traumatised over Israel's bombing attack. But not all Lebanese Australians can leave

image.altText: Maggie Smith, wearing a purple shirt, on a blurred background.

props.synopsis: Smith won an Oscar for The Prime of Miss Jean Brodie in 1970, and later won new fans as Professor McGonagall in the Harry Potter series and the Dowager Countess of Grantham in Downton Abbey.

title.children: Dame Maggie Smith, star of Downton Abbey and the Harry Potter films, dies aged 89

image.altText: the outside of a casino building

props.synopsis: Star Entertainment Group's shares bombed on Friday, losing close to half their already heavily discounted value, after the company narrowly avoided collapse, securing a last-minute $200 million bailout from its bankers.

title.children: How the end of money laundering sank Australia's casinos

image.altText: NZF_0046 destroyed house Russia invasion odyssey

props.synopsis: After Ukraine launched a surprise assault on Russian territory in August, the ABC's Europe correspondent Kathryn Diss and camera operator Fletcher were invited by the military to visit an occupied town in Russia.Â

title.children: ABC crew becomes subject of Russian criminal investigation for crossing border from Ukraine

image.altText: Treasurer Jim Chalmers talks National Accounts

props.synopsis: After days of speculation over who ordered public servants to take another look at the tax breaks, the treasurer has spoken up.Â

title.children: Jim Chalmers concedes he asked Treasury for negative gearing modelling

image.altText: Aerial shot of a group of houses, all of which have solar panels on their roof

props.synopsis: For decades, a big risk to Australia's electricity system has been excessive demand in summer. Now, it is excessive supply in spring.

title.children: 'Solar juggernaut with consequences': Market operator issues first-ever low-demand warning with risk of grid overload

image.altText: An older man in a suit speaks as Pope Francis looks on.

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Alexander De Croo's blistering welcome speech at the start of Francis's visit was one of the most pointed ever directed at the pope during a foreign trip, where diplomatic protocol usually keeps outrage out of public remarks.

title.children: Belgian PM and king blast Pope Francis for Catholic Church's legacy of covering up sexual abuse

image.altText: Jahrome Hughes of the Melbourne Storm sticks his tongue out as he runs with the football in an NRL game against the Roosters.

props.synopsis: The Melbourne Storm are the first team through to the NRL grand final after a thumping 48-18 win over the Sydney Roosters, but face a nervous wait after Nelson Asofa-Solomona was put on report for a high shot.

title.children: Jahrome Hughes shreds Roosters to send Melbourne Storm into another NRL grand final

image.altText: Jim Chalmers and NDRC Chairman Zheng Shanjie sit at a wide desk in a formal meeting room.

props.synopsis: Jim Chalmers meets with his Chinese counterpart to discuss the country's flagging economy and how that may impact Australia, as well as some lingering trade bans and the test-firing of an intercontinental ballistic missile.

title.children: He's the first Australian treasurer to visit Beijing in 7 years. So what did Chalmers's trip achieve?

image.altText: A young couple sitting at a table and smiling.

props.synopsis: Indigenous rights pioneer Joyce Clague persevered through early life on a mission and a childhood of racism and discrimination to become an international activist.

title.children: Tributes flow for First Nations activist with 'fire in the belly'

image.altText: A moving satellite image of a hurricane moving over the coast of Florida.

props.synopsis: Florida Governor Ron DeSantis says one death has been attribute to Helene so far, but that number will likely rise as the state wakes up on Friday morning.

title.children: Hurricane Helene weakens to tropical storm after making landfall in Florida

image.altText: A pink funeral booklet that has CHARLOTTE O'BRIEN in the title

props.synopsis: Charlotte O'Brien was 12 years old when she took her own life earlier this month. Her parents want her story to be shared.

title.children: Parents honour 'beautiful and kind' daughter who took her own life after alleged bullying

image.altText: A man with long blonde air wearing a navy singlet sitting on a chair

props.synopsis: As the inquest into Josh Warneke's death comes to an end, Ingrid Bishop says she is unable to grieve for her beloved son due to a lack of answers.

title.children: 'Tragic and violent secret': Mother pleads for answers about what happened to son found dead 14 years ago

image.altText: Melania Trump wearing a black dress and dark sunglasses. Donald Trump's silhouette is visible in the reflection of her glasses

props.synopsis: Former first lady Melania Trump sits down for a rare interview in which she reviews Donald Trump's political record and recounts the moment she learned her husband had been shot in an assassination attempt.Â

title.children: 'Some strong tweets, but everything else is great': The takeaways from Melania Trump's sit-down interview with Fox

image.altText: The word Cranbrook in gold on a sandstone column at the gates of a school.

props.synopsis: The independent review into the prestigious Sydney school was announced after the ABC's Four Corners exposed allegations of a toxic culture and revealed the former headmaster kept a teacher on despite knowing he sent graphic emails to a former female student.

title.children: Cranbrook School apologises for 'past failings' after a review that included child safety issues

image.altText: An elderly Japanese man wearing a green vest and hat sits on a chair looking directly at the camera with a pensive expression

props.synopsis: Human rights groups call for the end of the death penalty in Japan after Iwao Hakamada, who spent 45 years in solitary confinement on death row, is found to have been wrongfully convicted of murder.

title.children: Japanese man's acquittal after 48 years on death row puts nation's death penalty policy under spotlight

image.altText: A man standing in a crowd and waves

props.synopsis: Japan's next prime minister will be maverick regional politician Shigeru Ishiba, after the ruling Liberal Democratic Party elected him its new leader following the news Prime Minister Fumio Kishida would step down.

title.children: Japan's former defence chief who tried and failed to be prime minister many times finally wins the top job

image.altText: A graphic illustrating a social network of the pro-chemical lobby

props.synopsis: This social network, hosting figureheads of the pro-chemical lobby, can't be tracked down in a Google search. It collates "wiki dossiers" of vocal opponents of pesticides and chemicals along with advice on how to influence public discourse. Among its members are high-profile Australian industry players.Â

title.children: High-profile Australian industry players part of invite-only social network where pro-chemical lobby shares 'wiki' dossiers of known critics

image.altText: Historic moments from the 2004 and 2005 grand finals

props.synopsis: Saturday's clash between Brisbane and Sydney will be just the fourth time in AFL history where two teams based outside of Victoria have battled for the premiership cup. If the previous three are anything to go by, fans are in for one hell of a show.

title.children: Sabotage claims, heavyweight brawls and an iconic mark â fireworks guaranteed when non-Victorian teams meet in AFL grand finals

image.altText: A satelitte image shows cranes at shipyard in Wuhan Shi, China

props.synopsis: One of China's nuclear-powered submarines sank earlier this year, a potential embarrassment for Beijing as it seeks to expand its military capabilities.

title.children: Senior US defence official claims Chinese nuclear-powered attack submarine sank earlier this year

image.altText: A close up of a pile of SIM cards lying on a table, overlapping and showing their metal contacts

props.synopsis: A Chinese national charged over an elaborate phishing scam involving millions of fraudulent text messages claiming to be from agencies including Medicare, Centrelink, and Australia Post was trying to avoid detection, a court has heard.

title.children: Chinese national charged over scam involving 4.9 million fraudulent texts living unlawfully in Australia

image.altText: Zelenskyy

props.synopsis: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy meets with US President Joe Biden and Vice-President Kamala Harris at the White House after addressing the UN General Assembly this week.

title.children: Zelenskyy receives bipartisan support in Washington visit despite Republicans' claims of 'election interference'

image.altText: Fijiâs President Ratu Wiliame Katonivere speaking at the United Nations

props.synopsis: China has insisted the test was "not directed at any country or target" but it has still generated considerable unease in the Pacific.Â Â

title.children: China's launch of an intercontinental ballistic missile criticised by Fiji, Australia, Palau and New Zealand

image.altText: Katy Perry wears a heavy navy jacket and clear rimmed glasses and crouches beside a brown fluffy penguin.

props.synopsis: Things were a bit icy when the two biggest celebrities in Melbourne this week met ahead of the AFL grand final.

title.children: When Katy met Pesto: A pop megastar meets a mega-sized penguin

image.altText: Cigdem Aslan smiles, standing in a suburban garden beside red and pink flowers.

props.synopsis: The daughter of an Australian woman arrested in TÃ¼rkiye is calling on the federal government to help bring her mother home, saying the accusations against her are "categorically false".

title.children: Daughter pleads for release of Australian woman arrested in TÃ¼rkiye over alleged terrorism links

image.altText: Women in blue suits holding red folders throw white documents in the air

props.synopsis: Tasmania's Supreme Court quashes a tribunal decision that would have forced a museum to allow men to enter its women-only "Ladies' Lounge".

title.children: 'Women are better than men': Mona curator celebrates after Supreme Court win for ladies lounge

image.altText: optus 'yes' sign on glass fronted office block

props.synopsis: Optus failed to provide honest and credible communication during last year's phone outage, and should be forced to provide fair compensation in the event of another, a Senate committee has found.

title.children: Optus failed to honestly communicate in 'potentially dangerous' mass mobile and internet outage

image.altText: Adam Driver in Francis Ford Coppola's Megalopolis

props.synopsis: For better or worse, Frances Ford Coppola's long-awaited passion project featuring a laundry list of high-profile actors has finally hit cinemas.

title.children: Megalopolis took more than 40 years and $120m to make. It's been worth every bit of trouble
